snippet: The measures are part of the government’s response to reports that F.B.I. scientists have often vastly overstated their level of certainty about forensic test results.
abstract: Justice Dept release new rules designed to ensure testimony from forensic experts in criminal cases is based in sound science; rules are response to review of FBI testimony that found scientists overstated their certainty when matching hair samples, body fluid and other forensic evidence.
lead_paragraph: The measures are part of the government’s response to reports that F.B.I. scientists have often vastly overstated their level of certainty about forensic test results.

headline.main: Justice Dept. to Tighten Rules on Testimony by Scientists
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Tackles Flaws  in Testimony by Scientists
